noun.description: The most intense, exciting, or important point of something; a culmination or apex.
examples: a thrilling climax to the game

verb.description: Culminate in an exciting or impressive event; reach a climax.
examples: the day climaxed with a gala concert

origin: Mid 16th century (in rhetoric): from late Latin, from Greek klimax ladder, climax. The sense culmination arose in the late 18th century.
